article.description: QJ Peterson scored 24, Julian Eleby added 16 on 6-of-9 shooting and VMI coach Dan Earl earned his first-career win as the Keydets rolled to an 88-76 victory over Tusculum on Tuesday night.
article.headline: Peterson's 24 points lead VMI past Tusculum, 88-76
article.linkText: Peterson's 24 points lead VMI past Tusculum, 88-76
article.story: LEXINGTON, Va. -- QJ Peterson scored 24, Julian Eleby added 16 on 6-of-9 shooting and VMI coach Dan Earl earned his first-career win as the Keydets rolled to an 88-76 victory over Tusculum on Tuesday night. Peterson hit 7 of 12 field goals, including four 3-pointers, and Phillip Anglade finished with 12 points, on 6-of-8 shooting, and three blocked shots. VMI (1-1) opened up an 18-8 lead when Peterson hit a 3 just more than five minutes into the game and closed the first half with a 13-0 run en route to a 58-29 lead at the break. The Keydets made 22 of 32 first-half shots, including 8 of 14 from behind the arc, while Tusculum (1-1) shot just 29 percent and made 1-of-10 3-pointers before halftime. Javon Price scored 18, Darius Carter added 16 and Kendall Patterson 11 points for D-II Tusculum.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
